item.title: 美联储杰斐逊称官员应谨慎调整利率
item.description: 美联储副主席菲利普-杰斐逊（Philip Jefferson）表示，只要经济和劳动力市场保持强劲，政策制定者在调整利率时保持谨慎是合适的。【原文：Federal Reserve Vice Chair Philip Jefferson said it’s appropriate for policymakers to be cautious in adjusting interest rates, as long as the economy and labor market remain strong.】

item.title: 贸易战刺激避险需求，黄金维持在历史高位附近
item.description: 由于中美贸易战的开端激起了避险需求，黄金在亚洲交易中维持在纪录高位附近，此前一个交易日上涨了近 1%。【原文：Gold held near a record high in Asian trading, after rising by almost 1% in the previous session, as the opening salvos of the US-China trade war stoked haven demand.】

item.title: 爱尔兰部长提议在美国设立机构应对特朗普贸易风险
item.description: 爱尔兰外交和贸易部长将寻求批准成立一个总部设在美国的机构，该机构将就如何应对唐纳德-特朗普总统政府可能带来的政策变化向政府提供建议。【原文：Ireland’s foreign and trade minister will seek approval to establish a US-based body that will advise the government on how to deal with any potential policy changes from the administration of President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 中国农历新年票房达到创纪录的 13 亿美元
item.description: 在为期一周的春节长假期间，中国电影票房收入达到创纪录的 13 亿美元，这表明中国官员为刺激消费所做的努力正在奏效。【原文：China posted a record $1.3 billion in box office receipts over the week-long Lunar New Year holiday period, suggesting efforts by Chinese officials to boost consumer spending are working.】

item.title: 安德森-霍洛维茨（Andreessen Horowitz）在地铁窒息案宣判无罪后聘用丹尼尔-彭尼（Daniel Penny
item.description: 风险投资巨头安德森-霍洛维茨公司（Andreessen Horowitz）聘请了丹尼尔-彭尼（Daniel Penny），他是一名海军陆战队退伍军人，曾因对一名情绪激动的地铁乘客使用锁喉手段而成为全国知名人士。【原文：Venture capital giant Andreessen Horowitz has hired Daniel Penny, a Marine veteran who became a national figure after he used a chokehold on an agitated subway rider.】

item.title: 贸易战担忧与伊朗压力并存，石油止跌回升
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普加大了对伊朗的经济压力，抵消了人们对中美贸易战将损害全球经济增长的担忧，石油在下跌后企稳。【原文：Oil steadied after a decline as concerns that a trade war between the US and China will hurt global growth were offset by President Donald Trump ramping up economic pressure on Iran.】

item.title: 中国市场节后重开，应对特朗普关税影响
item.description: 2025年1月2日，星期四，中国上海，浦东陆家嘴金融区的建筑。中国国家主席习近平表示，预计2024年全年中国国内生产总值将增长5%左右，这标志着这个世界第二大经济体有望实现其官方目标。【原文：Buildings in Pudong's Lujiazui Financial District in Shanghai, China, on Thursday, Jan. 2, 2025. China’s gross domestic product is expected to expand around 5% for the full year of 2024, President Xi Jinping said, signaling the world’s second-largest economy is on track to meet its official target.】

item.title: 韩国通胀因能源和食品成本上升而回升
item.description: 由于能源和食品价格上涨，韩国的消费者通胀加速，这增加了政策制定者的担忧，因为政治动荡对本币造成了压力，而唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税言论则有可能对这个依赖贸易的经济体造成冲击。【原文：South Korea’s consumer inflation accelerated on the back of higher energy and food prices, adding to concerns for policymakers just as political turmoil weighs on the local currency and Donald Trump’s talk of tariffs threatens to sideswipe the trade-reliant economy.】

item.title: 澳大利亚主权基金在股市上涨中回报 12.2
item.description: 澳大利亚未来基金（Future Fund）2024 年的回报率达到 12.2%，原因是该主权财富基金增持了国际股票。【原文：Australia’s Future Fund posted a 12.2% return for 2024 as the sovereign wealth fund reaped the benefit of increasing positions in international equities.】

item.title: 中国重新开放，亚洲股市追随美国股市走高：市场综述
item.description: 周三，随着交易员们在中美贸易战和华尔街大型科技公司的财报中寻找出路，亚洲股市有望高开。【原文：Asian stocks were poised to open higher on Wednesday as traders navigate their way through a US-China trade war and earnings results from Wall Street’s big tech companies.】

item.title: 特朗普改弦易辙，美国人工智能安全研究所所长将离职
item.description: 美国人工智能安全研究所（AI Safety Institute）的最高官员即将卸任，这给特朗普政府领导下的一个专注于人工智能的重要政府机构的未来带来了新的不确定性。【原文：The top official at the US AI Safety Institute is stepping down, raising new uncertainty about the future of a key government group focused on artificial intelligence under the Trump administration.】

item.title: 美国顶级炼油商准备在关税问题上改用国产原油
item.description: 美国最大的炼油商和加拿大原油的主要买家马拉松石油公司（Marathon Petroleum）认为，如果唐纳德-特朗普总统与邻国的潜在贸易战限制了外国供应，中西部工厂将有大量机会转用国产石油。【原文：Marathon Petroleum, the largest US refiner and a major buyer of Canadian crude, sees ample opportunity to switch to domestic oil at its Midwest plants should President Donald Trump’s potential trade war with neighboring countries limit access to foreign supply.】

item.title: 液化天然气贸易商将从中国关税影响美国出口中获益
item.description: 中国对来自美国的液化天然气征收报复性关税，贸易公司和一些全球最大的能源公司将从中获益。【原文：Trading houses and some of the world’s biggest energy companies stand to gain from the retaliatory tariffs China is imposing on liquefied natural gas from the US.】

item.title: 奥利奥制造商警告可可成本将使每股收益下降 10
item.description: Mondelez International Inc.表示，"前所未有的可可成本上涨 "将导致 2025 年调整后每股收益下降约 10%。【原文：Mondelez International Inc. said “unprecedented cocoa cost inflation” would drive down adjusted earnings per share in 2025 by approximately 10%.】

item.title: 价值 800 亿美元的钻石市场崩盘让德比尔斯陷入困境
item.description:
需求的下滑使戴比尔斯陷入困境，并有可能使其所有者出售曾经的行业巨头的计划受挫。【原文：

A slump in demand has left De Beers floundering — and threatens to frustrate its owner’s plans to sell what was once the titan of the industry.

】

item.title: LG CNS 将在韩国 2022 年以来最大规模首次公开募股后亮相
item.description: 韩国 LG 集团旗下的多元化技术服务部门 LG CNS 公司在完成 1.2 万亿韩元（约合 8.21 亿美元）的首次公开募股后，将在首尔首次上市，这是韩国自 2022 年以来规模最大的一次公开募股。【原文：LG CNS Co., the diversified technology-services unit of South Korea’s LG Group, is set to make its market debut in Seoul after completing its 1.2 trillion won ($821 million) initial public offering, the nation’s largest since 2022.】

item.title: 日本酝酿更严格的管理层收购规则以保护少数股东
item.description: 日本的管理层收购热潮看来将受到更严格的监督，以保护公司私有化时的小股东。【原文：Japan’s boom in management buyouts looks set for stricter oversight to protect minority shareholders when companies go private.】

item.title: 泰国总理顾问加入大合唱，呼吁在风险加剧时降息
item.description: 泰国总理钦那瓦的一位顾问重申，政府呼吁央行今年进一步降息，以支持东南亚第二大经济体。【原文：An adviser to Thailand Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra reiterated the government’s calls for the central bank to deliver more rate cuts this year to support Southeast Asia’s second-largest economy.】

item.title: 经济衰退后新西兰失业率升至四年新高
item.description: 去年年底，新西兰的失业率升至四年来的最高点，因为经济急剧衰退导致招聘人数减少。【原文：New Zealand’s jobless rate rose to a four-year high at the end of last year as hiring fell in the wake of a sharp recession.】

item.title: Match 任命 Zillow 联合创始人 Rascoff 接替 Kim 担任首席执行官
item.description: Match Group Inc.任命Zillow Group Inc.联合创始人斯宾塞-拉斯科夫（Spencer Rascoff）为新任首席执行官，接替伯纳德-金（Bernard Kim），后者一直在努力结束该公司旗舰约会应用Tinder用户数量持续下降的局面。【原文：Match Group Inc. named Zillow Group Inc. co-founder Spencer Rascoff as its new chief executive officer, replacing Bernard Kim who has struggled to end a persistent decline in subscribers to the company’s flagship dating app Tinder.】

item.title: 马斯克因与 OpenAI 的激烈争吵而面临漫长的法庭斗争
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）要求立即阻止山姆-奥特曼（Sam Altman）重组 OpenAI 的举动在联邦法院受挫，一名法官表示，她不愿意在一个 "亿万富翁对决 "的案件中下达这样的命令。【原文：Elon Musk’s move to immediately block Sam Altman from restructuring OpenAI faltered in federal court, with a judge saying she was reluctant to issue such an order in a case pitting “billionaires versus billionaires.”】

item.title: 关税阴影笼罩，交易员对美债看法趋于中性
item.description: 过去一周，债券交易员放弃了对期货和现货国债的押注，转为更加中性，因为围绕关税的边缘政策给经济和美联储的前景蒙上了阴影，并有可能加剧动荡。【原文：Bond traders exited wagers in futures and cash Treasuries in the past week, turning more neutral as brinkmanship around tariffs clouded the outlook for the economy and the Federal Reserve and threatened to boost turbulence.】

item.title: 加州大学洛杉矶分校称洛杉矶野火损失高达 1640 亿美元
item.description: 根据一份新的报告，1 月份席卷洛杉矶县的大火造成的经济损失从 950 亿美元到 1,640 亿美元不等，有可能使这场大火成为美国历史上损失第二大的自然灾害。【原文：Economic losses from the fires that tore through Los Angeles County in January range from $95 billion to $164 billion, according to a new report, potentially making the blazes the second-costliest natural disaster in US history.】

item.title: 彼得-蒂尔支持的加密货币公司考虑 IPO
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，加密资产交易所运营商 Bullish Global 的支持者包括亿万富翁彼得-蒂尔（Peter Thiel），该公司正在考虑最快于今年进行首次公开募股。【原文：Bullish Global, a cryptoasset exchange operator whose backers include billionaire Peter Thiel, is considering an initial public offering as soon as this year, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: AMD 数据中心销售额低于预期，显示人工智能发展放缓
item.description: 高级微器件公司（Advanced Micro Devices Inc.【原文：Advanced Micro Devices Inc. reported disappointing results for its data center division, signaling that it’s not making gains on Nvidia Corp. in the market for artificial intelligence computing.】

item.title: 凭借广告和订阅的优势，Snap 的销售额超出预期
item.description: Snapchat 的所有者 Snap Inc. 公布的第四季度营收增幅高于预期，并对当期业绩做出了乐观的预测，这表明其广告业务的全面改革正在取得成效。受此消息影响，该公司股价飙升。【原文：Snapchat owner Snap Inc. reported a stronger-than-expected gain in fourth-quarter revenue and gave an upbeat forecast for the current period, a sign that an overhaul of its advertising business is paying off. The shares soared on the news.】

item.title: 云计算销售额低于预期，Alphabet下滑
item.description: 由于云计算业务增长放缓，谷歌母公司 Alphabet Inc.股价下跌超过 8%。【原文：Google parent Alphabet Inc. posted fourth-quarter revenue that missed analysts’ expectations as growth in its cloud business slowed. The shares fell more than 8%.】

item.title: 尽管关税延迟，加拿大银行和消费类股票仍面临风险
item.description: 在贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）总理的政府与白宫就推迟拟议关税达成协议后，加拿大股市周二上涨。但加拿大帝国商业银行（Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce）的策略师表示，投资者不应该被蒙蔽，以为贸易大戏就此结束。【原文：Canadian stocks rose Tuesday after an agreement between Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s government and the White House to delay proposed tariffs. But investors shouldn’t get lulled into thinking that’s the end of the trade drama, strategists at Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce say.】

item.title: IBM 长期销售增长前景超出预期
item.description: 国际商业机器公司（International Business Machines Corp.）在软件业务扩张的带动下，对未来几年的收入增长做出了强于预期的展望。【原文：International Business Machines Corp. gave a stronger-than-expected revenue growth outlook for the coming years led by the expansion in its software business.】

item.title: 美泰考虑提高芭比娃娃价格以应对特朗普关税
item.description: 美泰公司正在考虑提高其芭比娃娃和风火轮玩具的价格，以抵消唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税成本。【原文：Mattel Inc. is considering increasing the price of its Barbie and Hot Wheels toys to offset the cost of President Donald Trump’s tariffs.】
